title: Construction of a supramolecular light-harvesting system based on pillar[5]arene-mediated nanoparticles in water
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4YA00252K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Xiuxiu Li, Qiaona Zhang, Xiaoman Dang, Fengyao Cui, Zheng-Yi Li, Xiao-Qiang Sun, Tangxin Xiao
An artificial light-harvesting system has been fabricated through the host–guest complexation of WP5 and CPy in water. The resultant materials show adjustable fluorescence and have been employed as a fluorescent ink for information encryption.
